Product_name: Mansfield Summit White Elongated Chair Height 2-piece WaterSense Toilet 12-in Rough-In (ADA Compliant)
Subject: Looks good and works well in our small space.
Author: Ron
Review: We are renovating a small half bath, and we needed to replace an old high-flow toilet. We chose the round bowl because of our limited space between the toilet and the vanity. This new toilet fits our small space and looks very good. The package included everything needed for a complete installation except the line from the water supply to the tank inlet. They really could not include that line because I needed to measure the distance to buy the correct line length. Everything was packaged compactly in an single box with lifting handles on the sides. An inner box contains the tank, tank cover, and instructions. I didn't notice that the cover was packed below the tank until after removing the tank from the box. The instructions were clear, and the installation was reasonable. It was easy to set the toilet square and level, and there were no leaks after following the instructions. Before trying this toilet, I had some general concern about the effectiveness of the low-flow operation, but this toilet appears to have a powerful flush. The tank is almost as large as the one on the old high-flow toilet, but the mechanism appears to meter less than half of the tank capacity for each flush. The weight of the remaining water provides more force for the limited water that is delivered in a flush. Each flush appears to clear the bowl completely, and we have not had any problems with it. This bowl height of this toilet is higher than the one that we replaced. Our consensus is that this height is more comfortable than the lower bowl, but I expect that is a matter of personal preference. This provided a good solution for our particular renovation need. It fits our small space, works well, and looks good.

Subject: efficient, powerfull, economical flusher
Author: fluffhead303
Review: Overall, I'm really happy with this fixture. I chose this over similar models from the other names because it is American made and nicely priced. I like the 3" rigid flapper with replaceable silicone rubber seal a lot. It closes with a slight bang, but the flush is amazingly powerful, especially considering the efficiency. I think a softer rubber universal replacement flapper would make it quieter, but in my powder room, the noise is no issue. I like that it has 3 tank bolts instead of 2. The patented bolt design is strange, but I still like it better than Kohler's 3-bolt/funky seal design. There is no need for lots of torque, but you must be methodical in tightening them. Do it gradually in an alternating pattern like with lug nuts. The documentation indicates the correct order. I learned if you rush that step, it will leak. Product_name: Mansfield Summit White Elongated Chair Height 2-piece WaterSense Toilet 12-in Rough-In (ADA Compliant)
Subject: Decent toilet but has few issues
Author: DIYer
Review: This is a nice toilet; looks nice and sleek. I am *generally* happy with my purchase, but there were a few things that posed an issue. First, the bolts that hold the toilet tank to the bowl; these are not washers and bolts that used to be standard (but seem to be with repair kits; go figure), but rather a bolt with a rubber head. I had difficulty with two of three bolts, in that they leaked. I had to loosen, reset, tighten and really torque the bolts down, to the point I was afraid I would crack the porcelain. I don't know why this was changed from the old rubber washer with separate bolt; I've never had any issues with that style leaking in the past. Second, the fill valve, although a Fluidmaster and a reputable brand, "popped" on the second day after install. I heard a horrific noise, and went to the bathroom to see what had happened. I thought a pipe had burst, only to find that the toilet water was now running. Lifting the lid, I found that the noise was caused by the top of the fill valve giving way, and hitting the toilet tank cover, which was now continually filling. Apparently a "lesser quality" fill valve was included, and I had to purchase another, adding $20 to the original cost of the toilet. Third, the flapper included is horrible. The bottom is made of plastic, not rubber, and consequently, when the flap closes, it makes a LOUD slapping sound. This too had to be replaced along with the fill valve, included in the Fluidmaster Repair Kit that I had to purchase. Why have a "silent close" lid, when the sound of the flapper closing is about a loud as a toilet seat dropping? Makes no sense. I imagine that "cheaper" lower quality fill valves come with the toilet. Please, either supply quality kits with the toilet and raise the price, or just don't supply them at all, and lower the price of the toilet. While it's been quite a few years since I had to purchase a new toilet, I realize that they are now made to conserve water, but what is the point if you have to flush the toilet three times in order to have a completely empty toilet? In general, it's a toilet. Personally, I'm not into the "design" as I am with the function. While it was convenient to have everything supplied for installation, it's still aggravating to have to go back to the store to replace an inferior quality fill valve and flap. The water conservation feature is something I will have to live with since this seems to be the standard now. Take away is this; hold onto your old toilet as long as you can, because prices are going up, and quality is going down.

If you add the rubber tank washers as spacers, you don't have to worry about porcelain to porcelain contact as the tank to toilet washer is compressed by the weight of the water in the tank. As stated, you can upgrade to the other brand flapper and greatly improve your flush performance.

Subject: Poor Quality

Review: I was furnished this product to conduct testing and provide a review. Based on the item I had, I cannot recommend this product. The instructions were fairly straight forward with diagrams. To test this toilet, I placed it on a level surface, hooked it up to a garden hose, and hooked that up to a standard supply line. The hose water pressure was the same as the interior of the house. The first real issue was with the bowl gasket. It had a grove that should be able to go over a lip on the bowl, but there was no lip. Even with heavy tightening of the bolts, the gasket would not sit right (see photo 1). I even tried to seat it onto the bowl first and it still would not seat well (photo 2). The fill valve was way off from the proper adjustment. The water kept flowing. It took a lot of turns to get the water to the right level. I would have expected the fill valve to at least be close to the right setting. After I set the water level, I added a blue dye so I could see how well the water circulated in the bowl during a flush (Photo 3). It actually did quite well in covering all sides of the bowl (Photo 4). The last issue I had was with the flapper. Most flappers will open up and remain open until the tank is fairly empty. On this tank, I had to hold the handle down during the entire flush in order to empty the tank. Pressing and releasing a second or two resulted in half the tank not emptying (photo 5). This flapper could not go back because the fill tube was in the way (photo 6). Bad design? I try to give every product I test the benefit of the doubt, but unfortunately, if this particular unit is typical of the bulk of the toilets, I just cannot recommend it.

Review: Likes: Mansfield customer service was awesome. I called and spoke with them twice while deciding on purchasing this and they were very helpful. The flush is very strong when you hold the handle down (see dislikes) and it has anti-stick coating like other higher-end brand toilets. I chose it over similar American Standard (Champion) and Kohler (Cimmaron) toilets available at Lowes because these toilets have serious quality control issues (cracking and issues with flush valves, respectively). I did NOT use the included wax ring but instead used the Danco 4.75-in Toilet Wax Ring with Bolts Item #: 3844101 Model #: 10826X which I highly recommend as this allows you to reposition toilet if needed and it's a very secure fit on this toilet. Dislikes: You must hold the handle down to get a good flush. I talked to Mansfield about this and it's the way it's designed. The flapper they have doesn't float at all. I have purchased a new flapper to try from HomeDepot (Fluidmaster Universal 3 in. Premium Adjustable Toilet Flapper) that I'm hoping will allow for a good flush without holding the handle down. The flush is loud and the flapper slams down hard if you don't hold the handle down long enough. Also, it takes a long time for the tank to fill after flushing and it's louder than our previous toilet-most of the water goes into the bowl and not the tank. My wife feels the toilet sits a little high, but I'm fine with it-we're the same height so personal preference. Overall I'm pretty happy with the toilet and was VERY impressed with Mansfield's customer service. I had a hard time finding any information about this toilet before I bought, so I'm hoping this review helps other people decide on it.
